text: anybody know a way to remove/disable *srcset*?
<@U2PDTMH53|adriancblack> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/adriancblack/F4S1L59MG/screen_shot_2017-03-30_at_14.04.39.jpg|template preview image tag>
<@U2PDTMH53|adriancblack> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/adriancblack/F4RA7NG6L/screen_shot_2017-03-30_at_14.04.30.jpg|published page from template image tag>

<@U22PU4G4A> I went ahead and wrote up a short situation regarding Google Site Search, what to do now, and future options for HubSpot users. 
I didn’t know if it would warrant sharing with HubSpot users as the last day to buy credits is… tomorrow! 
<https://www.lean-labs.com/blog/google-site-search-is-shutting-down-4-alternatives-for-HubSpot-marketers>
<@U26BLKGE4> here’s the blog post I mentioned ^^
<@U2Q5LPHGS> pinned a message to this channel.
Awesome, thanks man!
Thanks <@U2SJA29B4>. I’ll check out the post!

By the way, since we’ve all talked about it here previously, we just released Accelerated Mobile Pages for the Blog to all customers. More info on enabling it is here: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/how-to-use-accelerated-mobile-pages-amp-in-HubSpot>
cool, i’m doing a blog post on the AMP effect with some of our clients.
spoiler alert: it’s not all positive.
Agree. We’ve seen some positive results, but it’s mixed. I’d say it’s definitely worth testing though.
Great post by the way, <@U2SJA29B4>. Sharing it now.
thx :thumbsup:
Can I get a linkto your AMP piece <@U2SJA29B4> ? Curious how this could have negative effects.

sure <@U26EWKYLC> … in short… unless you take some specific actions.. it’ll absolutely devastate conversion rates.  I’ll ping you when I have it written up, but just to set expectations we’re still collecting some data on what works best and haven’t started writing yet.
jvocell: Hi <@U22PU4G4A> could you please invite to our developer <mailto:ppujol@inboundemotion.com|ppujol@inboundemotion.com> ? Thanks!
This is causing issues on a module on the their homepage as its applying the opacity
this was working fine about an hour ago and now all the sudden this appeared after I returned from lunch. No one else was working on this template
Does anyone else have this loading on their templates
I think that's where the styles are inserted from the page-level editor... was anyone working there (not design manager, but website pages editor?)?
Not that I am aware of. ill check that spot real quick
Not seeing anything inserted in there
found it, you were right it was in there
that's odd cause I never go in that area
thanks <@U26BLKGE4>
:thumbsup:
<@U2Q5LPHGS> All set! Just invited them.
Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
